key_risks: Regulatory and compliance issues leading to financial penalties and reputational damage
Economic sensitivity and vulnerability to macroeconomic downturns
Cybersecurity risks and potential data breaches
Intense competitive pressures from larger payment networks and fintech disruptors
controversies: Deceptive marketing practices related to credit card add-on products
environmental_issues: Introduction of eco-friendly practices such as paperless statements
social_issues: Refunds and penalties due to misleading consumers into purchasing unnecessary products
governance_issues: Underinvestment in compliance infrastructure leading to regulatory scrutiny
Leadership changes and strategic shifts under new CEO

sources.snippet: Discover 'paying the price' for not investing in compliance. 2023-08-21T18:20:00Z By Aaron Nicodemus. sources.title: Discover Bank - Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
sources.snippet: This action results from an investigation started by the FDIC which the CFPB joined in 2011. The joint investigation concerned deceptive telemarketing and sales tactics used by Discover to mislead consumers into paying for various credit card "add-on products" - payment protection, credit score tracking, identity theft protection, and wallet protection.
